data.title: Yolo Basin Foundation
data.text:
The Yolo Bypass Wildlife Area is open to the public!

Please click here to view a map to showing access to different areas of the YBWA. For your safety, please remember not to go beyond any barricades at any time.

Yolo Basin Foundation is currently hiring for two positions:

Community Engagement Coordinator

The Community Engagement Coordinator is responsible for:

1) Community Outreach

2) Volunteer Coordination

3) Adult and Family Environmental Education Programs

The coordinator organizes public tours of the local wetlands, facilitates YBF participation at community events and festivals, and promotes YBF programs through press releases, social media and other outreach avenues. The coordinator recruits, trains, manages and supports volunteers for youth and community education programs, special events, monthly wetland and wildlife tours, summertime bat programs, clean-up projects, and fundraising events. This position assists with the Discover the Flyway environmental education program for K-12 schools and summer camps.

Submit your resume and cover letter to resumes@yolobasin.org to apply.

Part-Time Naturalist

A part-time naturalist position with Yolo Basin Foundationâ€™s Discover the Flyway school program will provide a wealth of knowledge about the Yolo Bypass Wildlife Area (YBWA), environmental education and interpretation, and identification of local plants and animals. A Discover the Flyway naturalist will learn and practice techniques for teaching, interpreting, and public speaking.

Primary responsibility of the Discover the Flyway naturalist is to lead the Discover the Flyway school program at the Yolo Demonstration Wetlands and in the Yolo Bypass Wildlife Area. Activities take place outdoors in all weather during the school day.

Submit your resume and cover letter to hsatter@yolobasin.org to apply.
